pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:0.5.eng: 40. The training rule on tooth cleaners

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sabbapaṃsukūliko susāne viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.2.eng: At that time a monk who only used discarded things was staying in a charnel ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.3.pli: So manussehi diyyamānaṃ na icchati paṭiggahetuṃ, susānepi rukkhamūlepi ummārepi ayyavosāṭitakāni sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.3.eng: He disliked receiving things from people. Instead he would take whatever was offered to the dead at the charnel ground, at the foot of trees, or at the threshold, and he would use that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.3.comm: “The threshold”, ummāra, would seem to refer the entry point to the charnel ground. Sp-yoj 2.263: Ummārepīti susānassa indakhīlepi, “Ummārepī: also at the entry post to the charnel ground.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayaṃ bhikkhu amhākaṃ ayyavosāṭitakāni sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.5.eng: “How can this monk take the offerings to our ancestors and use them?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.5.comm: Although this is not specified by the text, such offerings would mostly have been food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.6.pli: Theroyaṃ bhikkhu vaṭharo manussamaṃsaṃ maññe khādatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.6.eng: This monk is big and strong. He probably eats human flesh too!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.7.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.8.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āharissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.9.eng: “How can this monk eat food that hasn’t been given?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āharasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āharissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.13.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats food that has not been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū udakadantapone kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks did not use water or tooth cleaners because they were afraid of wrongdoing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.2.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.3.eng: “Monks, I allow you to use water and tooth cleaners after taking them yourselves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.4.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.4.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.5.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhareyya, aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:2.5.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats food that has not been given, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.6.eng: what has not been received is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.8.pli: kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā dente hatthapāse ṭhito kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā paṭiggaṇhāti, etaṃ dinnaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.8.eng: standing within arm’s reach of one giving by body or by what is connected to his body or by releasing, he receives it by body or by what is connected to his body—this is called “given”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.10.pli: udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā yaṃ kiñci ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ, eso āhāro nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.10.eng: whatever is edible, apart from water and tooth cleaners—this is called “food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.11.eng: Except for water and tooth cleaners:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.12.eng: apart from water and tooth cleaners.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.13.eng: If he takes it with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.1.14.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.1.pli: Appaṭiggahitake appaṭiggahitakasaññī adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhāreti, aññatra udakadantaponā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.1.eng: If it has not been received, and he does not perceive it as such, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.2.pli: Appaṭiggahitake vematiko adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhāreti, aññatra udakadantaponā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.2.eng: If it has not been received, but he is unsure of it, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.3.pli: Appaṭiggahitake paṭiggahitakasaññī adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhāreti, aññatra udakadantaponā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.3.eng: If it has not been not received, but he perceives it as such, and he eats it, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.4.eng: If it has been received, but he does not perceive it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.5.eng: If it has been received, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.2.6.eng: If it has been received, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.2.eng: if it is water or tooth cleaners;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.3.pli: cattāri mahāvikaṭāni sati paccaye asati kappiyakārake sāmaṃ gahetvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.3.eng: if, when there is a reason, but there is no attendant, he himself takes the four foul edibles and eats them;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.3.comm: These are dung, urine, ash, and clay, see Kd 6:14.6.4.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.6.eng: The training rule on tooth cleaners, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.7.eng: The fourth subchapter on eating is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.10.eng: And two are spoken on invitations;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.11.eng: At the wrong time, store, milk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc40:3.3.12.eng: With tooth cleaner—those are the ten.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:0.5.eng: 41. The training rule on naked ascetics

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa khādanīyaṃ ussannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.2.eng: the Sangha had an abundance of fresh food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi. “Tenahānanda, vighāsādānaṃ pūvaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.3.eng: Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha, who said, “Well then, Ānanda, give the cookies to those who take leftovers.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā vighāsāde paṭipāṭiyā nisīdāpetvā ekekaṃ pūvaṃ dento aññatarissā paribbājikāya ekaṃ maññamāno dve pūve adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.4.eng: “Yes, sir.” Ānanda had them sit in a row and gave them one cookie each, until he accidentally gave two to a female wanderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.5.pli: Sāmantā paribbājikāyo taṃ paribbājikaṃ etadavocuṃ—“jāro te eso samaṇo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.5.eng: The female wanderers sitting next to her said to her, “This monastic is your lover.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.6.pli: “Na me so samaṇo jāro, ekaṃ maññamāno dve pūve adāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.6.eng: “He’s not. He gave me two, thinking they were one.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.8.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando ekekaṃ pūvaṃ dento tassāyeva paribbājikāya ekaṃ maññamāno dve pūve adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.8.eng: And a third time Ānanda gave them one cookie each, until he accidentally gave two to that same female wanderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.9.pli: Sāmantā paribbājikāyo taṃ paribbājikaṃ etadavocuṃ—“jāro te eso samaṇo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.9.eng: Once again the female wanderers sitting next to her said to her, “This monastic is your lover.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.10.pli: “Na me so samaṇo jāro, ekaṃ maññamāno dve pūve adāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.10.eng: “He’s not. He gave me two, thinking they were one.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.1.11.eng: And they started to argue about whether or not they were lovers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.1.eng: A certain Ājīvaka ascetic, too, went to that distribution of food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu pahūtena sappinā odanaṃ madditvā tassa ājīvakassa mahantaṃ piṇḍaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.2.eng: A monk mixed rice with a large amount of ghee and gave him a large lump.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.3.pli: Atha kho so ājīvako taṃ piṇḍaṃ ādāya agamāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.4.pli: Aññataro ājīvako taṃ ājīvakaṃ etadavoca—“kuto tayā, āvuso, piṇḍo laddho”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.4.eng: Another Ājīvaka asked him, “Where did you get that lump?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.5.eng: “From the food distribution of the ascetic Gotama, that shaven-headed householder.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho upāsakā tesaṃ ājīvakānaṃ imaṃ kathāsallāpaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.6.eng: Some lay followers overheard that conversation between those Ājīvaka ascetics.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho te upāsakā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te upāsakā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.7.eng: They then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.8.pli: “ime, bhante, titthiyā avaṇṇakāmā buddhassa avaṇṇakāmā dhammassa avaṇṇakāmā saṅghassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.8.eng: “Sir, these monastics of other religions want to disparage the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.9.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyā titthiyānaṃ sahatthā na dadeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.9.eng: It would be good if the monks didn’t personally give anything to the monastics of other religions.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te upāsake dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi. Atha kho te upāsakā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.10.eng: After the Buddha had instructed, inspired, and gladdened those lay followers with a teaching, they got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated him with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.12.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.12.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.13.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.14.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:1.2.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk personally gives fresh or cooked food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.8.pli: bhikkhuñca sāmaṇerañca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.8.eng: any male wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.10.pli: bhikkhuniñca sikkhamānañca sāmaṇeriñca ṭhapetvā yā kāci paribbājikasamāpannā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.10.eng: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.12.pli: pañca bhojanāni—udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.12.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, water, and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.14.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.14.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.16.pli: kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.1.16.eng: if he gives by body or by what is connected to the body or by releasing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.1.pli: Titthiye titthiyasaññī sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.1.eng: If it is a monastic of another religion, and he perceives them as such, and he personally gives them fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.2.pli: Titthiye vematiko sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.2.eng: If it is a monastic of another religion, but he is unsure of it, and he personally gives them fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.3.pli: Titthiye atitthiyasaññī sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.3.eng: If it is a monastic of another religion, but he does not perceive them as such, and he personally gives them fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.4.eng: If he gives water or a tooth cleaner, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a monastic of another religion, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a monastic of another religion, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a monastic of another religion, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.2.eng: if he does not give, but has it given;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.3.eng: if he gives by placing it near the person;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.4.eng: if he gives ointments for external use;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc41:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on naked ascetics, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:0.5.eng: 42. The training rule on sending away

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhātuno saddhivihārikaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan said to his brother’s student,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.3.eng: “Come, let’s go to the village for alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.4.eng: Then, without getting him any food, he sent him away, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.5.pli: “gacchāvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.5.eng: “Go away! I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.6.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu upakaṭṭhe kāle nāsakkhi piṇḍāya carituṃ, paṭikkamanepi bhattavissaggaṃ na sambhāvesi, chinnabhatto ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.6.eng: But since the right time for eating was coming to an end, the student was unable to walk for alms. As he returned to the monastery, there was nobody offering food, and so he missed his meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.7.eng: He then went to the monastery and told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.8.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhikkhuṃ—‘ehāvuso, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissāmā’ti tassa adāpetvā uyyojessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.9.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda say to a monk, ‘Come, let’s go to the village for alms,’ and then send him away without getting him any food?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, bhikkhuṃ—‘ehāvuso, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissāmā’ti tassa adāpetvā uyyojesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.10.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhuṃ—“ehāvuso, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissāmā”ti tassa adāpetvā uyyojessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.13.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ—‘ehāvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā’ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya— ‘gacchāvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī’ti, etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk says to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, whether he has had food given to him or not, sends him away, saying, “Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.7.eng: Come … to the village or town:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.8.pli: gāmopi nigamopi nagarampi, gāmo ceva nigamo ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.8.eng: a village, also a town, also a city; both a village and a town.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.9.eng: He has had food given to him:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.10.pli: yāguṃ vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dāpetvā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.10.eng: he has had congee, a meal, fresh food, or cooked food given to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.12.eng: he has not had anything given to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.14.pli: mātugāmena saddhiṃ hasitukāmo kīḷitukāmo raho nisīditukāmo anācāraṃ ācaritukāmo evaṃ vadeti— “gacchāvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī”ti uyyojeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.14.eng: if, wanting to laugh with a woman, wanting to enjoy himself with her, wanting to sit down in private with her, wanting to misbehave with her, he says, “Go away! I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,” and he sends him away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.15.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vā savanūpacāraṃ vā vijahantassa āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.15.eng: If the second monk is in the process of going beyond sight or beyond hearing, the first monk commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.16.eng: When the second monk has gone beyond, the first monk commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.17.eng: He does so only for this reason and no other:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.18.pli: na añño koci paccayo hoti uyyojetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.18.eng: there is no other reason for sending him away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.1.eng: If the second monk is fully ordained, and the first monk perceives him as such, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.2.eng: If the second monk is fully ordained, but the first monk is unsure of it, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.3.eng: If the second monk is fully ordained, but the first monk does not perceive him as such, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.4.eng: If he puts him down, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.4.comm: “Puts him down” renders kalisāsanaṁ āropeti. Sp 2.277: Kalisāsanaṁ āropetīti “kalī”ti kodho; tassa sāsanaṁ āropeti; kodhassa āṇaṁ āropeti; kodhavasena ṭhānanisajjādīsu dosaṁ dassetvā “passatha bho imassa ṭhānaṁ, nisajjaṁ ālokitaṁ vilokitaṁ khāṇuko viya tiṭṭhati, sunakho viya nisīdati, makkaṭo viya ito cito ca viloketī”ti evaṁ amanāpavacanaṁ vadati “appeva nāma imināpi ubbāḷho pakkameyyā”ti. “Kalisāsanaṁ āropeti: kali means anger. He inflicts a teaching because of that; he inflicts punishment because of anger. He finds faults because of anger in regard to the standing, sitting, etc., saying, ‘See how he stands, sits, looks this way and that. He stands like a post, sits like a dog, looks here and there like a monkey.’ He speaks such unpleasant speech hoping he will depart in a huff.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.5.eng: If he sends away one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.6.eng: If he puts him down, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.7.eng: If the other is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.8.eng: If the other is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.9.eng: If the other is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.2.eng: if he sends him away, thinking, “Together we won’t get enough;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.3.eng: if he sends him away, thinking, “If he sees these valuable goods, he’ll become greedy;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.4.eng: if he sends him away, thinking, “If he sees this woman, he’ll become lustful;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.5.pli: “gilānassa vā ohiyyakassa vā vihārapālassa vā yāguṃ vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā nīharā”ti uyyojeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.5.eng: if he sends him away, saying, “Take congee or a meal or fresh food or cooked food to the one who is sick or to the one who is left behind or to the one who is guarding the dwellings;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.6.eng: if he does not want to misbehave;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.7.eng: if he sends him away when there is something to be done;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on sending away, the second, is finished.
